thread.title: Team Tips: Ponga gets crack, Raider returns
thread.title_full: Team Tips: Ponga gets crack, Raider returns

title: Team Tips: Ponga gets crack, Raider returns

organizations.name: southern cross group stadium cronulla crush canberra

text:
Can Storm fit Billy in? 0:49 NRL team tips: team news, predicted line-ups for Round 3 March 14, 2017 12:52pm Source: FOX SPORTS COWBOYS sensation Kalyn Ponga is the big winner out of North Queensland’s injury crisis, with Paul Green to name the one-man highlights reel at fullback against Manly. 
Elsewhere, Melbourne’s Billy Slater will line up for his first game in 374 days, while skipper Jarrod Croker will also be named to make an early return from injury in a much-needed boost for the winless Raiders. 
There’s also players going down all over the shop with the Titans hardest hit, and Kieran Foran no chance for the Warriors. 
We’ve got the inside word on who will replace them and predicted the changes ahead of the action this week. 
Get all the latest team news ahead of Tuesday’s team announcements here. 
STORM V BRONCOS 
8.05pm AEDT Thursday, March 16 at AAMI Park 
Storm mail: Billy Slater is a red hot chance to return this week which means Cameron Munster will return to the halves. Jesse Bromwich is still another week away from returning from a thumb injury. 
Predicted Round 3 Storm team: Billy Slater, Suliasi Vunivalu, Will Chambers, Cheyse Blair, Josh Addo-Carr, Cameron Munster, Cooper Cronk, Christian Welch, Cameron Smith, Jordan McLean, Felise Kaufusi, Kenny Bromwich, Dale Finucane. Interchange: Tim Glasby, Joe Stimson, Nelson Asofa-Solomona, Vincent Leuluai. 18th and 19th man: Mark Nicholls, Ryley Jacks Billy Slater training in Melbourne. Source: News Corp Australia 
Broncos mail: Matt Gillett is expected to return from concussion. Tevita Pangai Jnr and Jai Arrow are battling ankle issues. George Fai will join the side if one of the big men are ruled out. 
Predicted Round 3 Broncos team: Darius Boyd, Corey Oates, James Roberts, Tautau Moga, Jordan Kahu, Anthony Milford, Ben Hunt, Korbin Sims, Andrew McCullough, Adam Blair, Sam Thaiday, Matt Gillett, Josh McGuire. Interchange: Alex Glenn, Tevita Pangai, Herman Ese’ese, Jai Arrow 18th and 19th man: Benji Marshall, George Fai 
BULLDOGS V WARRIORS 
6pm AEDT Friday, March 17 at Forsyth Barr Stadium 
Bulldogs mail: With Will Hopoate (face) and Kerrod Holland (shoulder) sidelined, 21-year-old winger Marcelo Montoya will be in the mix to make his NRL debut. Both Tyrone Phillips, Remis Smith and Brad Abbey will be in contention for a spot in the starting side. 
Predicted Round 3 Bulldogs team: Brett Morris, Brad Abbey, Josh Morris, Brenko Lee, Marcelo Montoya, Josh Reynolds, Moses Mbye, Aiden Tolman, Michael Lichaa, James Graham, Josh Jackson, Greg Eastwood, David Klemmer. Interchange: Sam Kasiano, Danny Fualalo, Adam Elliott, Raymond Faitala-Mariner. 18th and 19th man: Brad Abbey, Francis Tualau Foran gets final all-clear 1:01 
Warriors mail: While Kieran Foran has been cleared by the NRL to make his return this weekend, he won’t take the field this week. Still dealing with a shoulder issue, the playmaker is expected to be closer to round four or five. 
Predicted Round 3 Warriors team: Roger Tuivasa-Sheck, Tuimoala Lolohea, David Fusitu’a, Solomone Kata, Ken Maumalo, Mafoa’aeata Hingano, Shaun Johnson, Albert Vete, Issac Luke, Charlie Gubb, Bunty Afoa, Ryan Hoffman, Simon Mannering. Interchange: Erin Clark, Jacob Lillyman, Sam Lisone, Bodene Thompson. 18th and 19th man: James Gavet, Kieran Foran 
Ben Ikin, Nathan Ryan and Ben Glover are joined by Dragons recruitment boss Ian Millward to discuss the club’s recruitment plan and why it revolves around Ben Hunt. 
You can also subscribe via iTunes or for Android users, listen on the iPP Podcast Player app. 
TITANS V EELS 
8.05pm AEDT Friday, March 17 at Cbus Super Stadium 
Titans mail: With Karl Lawton (shoulder), Jarryd Hayne (ankle) and Anthony Don (pec) sidelined with injury, the Titans will be forced to shuffle their backline. We expect Will Zillman and Dan Sarginson to be named this week despite missing out on Saturday’s loss to the Knights. 
Daniel Vidot is also out with a groin injury. 
Predicted Round 3 Titans team: Will Zillman, Dan Sarginson, Chris McQueen, Konrad Hurrell, Tyronne Roberts-Davis, Kane Elgey, Ashley Taylor, Jarrod Wallace, Tyrone Roberts, Ryan James, Kevin Proctor, Joe Greenwood, Leivaha Pulu. Interchange: Nathaniel Peteru, Agnatius Paasi, Eddy Pettybourne, Pat Vaivai. 18th and 19th man: Max King, Morgan Boyle. 
Eels mail: No changes expected. Kirisome Auva’a has been cleared to return from suspension but is expected to play NSW Cup. Kirisome Auva'a playing against the Eels. Source: News Corp Australia 
Predicted Round 3 Eels team: Bevan French, Semi Radradra, Michael Jennings, Brad Takairangi, Josh Hoffman, Clint Gutherson, Corey Norman, Suaia Matagi, Kaysa Pritchard, Tim Mannah, Manu Ma’u, Tepai Moeroa, Beau Scott. Interchange: Nathan Brown, Daniel Alvaro, Rory O’Brien, Frank Pritchard. 18th and 19th man: David Gower, Cameron King. 
KNIGHTS V RABBITOHS 
4.30pm AEDT Saturday, March 18 at McDonald Jones Stadium 
Knights mail: No changes expected. 
Predicted Round 3 Knights team: Brendan Elliott, Ken Sio, Dane Gagai, Peter Mata’utia, Nathan Ross, Brock Lamb, Trent Hodkinson, Daniel Saifiti, Danny Levi, Josh Starling, Sione Mata’utia, Jamie Buhrer, Mitchell Barnett. Interchange: Luke Yates, Jack Stockwell, Sam Stone, Jacob Saifiti. 18th and 19th man: Anthony Tupou, Tyler Randall. 
Rabbitohs mail: No changes expected. 
Predicted Round 3 Rabbitohs team: Alex Johnston, Braidon Burns, Hymel Hunt, Robert Jennings, Bryson Goodwin, Cody Walker, Adam Reynolds, Zane Musgrove, Robbie Farah, George Burgess, John Sutton, Kyle Turner, Sam Burgess. Interchange: Jason Clark, Damien Cook, Angus Crichton, Robbie Rochow. 18th and 19th man: David Tyrrell, Anthony Cherrington. 
PANTHERS V ROOSTERS 
7pm AEDT Saturday, March 18 at Pepper Stadium Debutant axes Tedesco 1:15 
Panthers mail: Bryce Cartwright (bone bruising) is still considered some chance of suiting up but James Fisher-Harris is expected to move into the starting side if Cartwright succumbs to an ankle injuet. Dallin Watene-Zelezniak is set to return from a knee injury. 
Predicted Round 3 Panthers team: Matthew Moylan, Dean Whare, Waqa Blake, Tyrone Peachey, Dallin Watene-Zelezniak, Te Maire Martin, Nathan Cleary, James Tamou, Peter Wallace, Reagan Campbell-Gillard, James Fisher-Harris, Isaah Yeo, Trent Merrin. Interchange: Lelani Latu, Sitaleki Akauola, Villame Kikau, Tim Browne. 18th and 19th man: Moses Leota, Dylan Edwards. 
Roosters mail: Blake Ferguson is in doubt with a rib issue which means Dale Copley will come into the frame if he is unfit. 
Kane Evans missed last week’s game due to a calf strain but is expected to return this week, so too Isaac Liu (shoulder). 
Predicted Round 3 Roosters team: Michael Gordon, Daniel Tupou, Latrell Mitchell, Dale Copley, Shaun Kenny-Dowall, Luke Keary, Mitchell Pearce, Jared Waerea-Hargreaves, Jake Friend, Dylan Napa, Boyd Cordner, Mitchell Aubusson, Aidan Guerra. Interchange: Connor Watson, Zane Tetevano, Isaac Liu, Kane Evans. 18th and 19th man: Chris Smith, Ryan Matterson 
COWBOYS V SEA EAGLES 
9pm AEDT Saturday, March 18 at 1300SMILES Stadium Kalyn Ponga in action. Source: News Corp Australia 
Cowboys mail: Kalyn Ponga will come in for Lachlan Coote with the fullback suffering a torn calf on Friday night. 
Antonio Winterstein fractured his forearm with Javid Bowen to earn a recall after replacing the winger in round one. 
Matt Scott’s knee injury opens up a place on the bench with John Asiata likely to be promoted to the starting side. 
Shaun Fensom is set to come into the side if Jason Taumalolo (shoulder charge) loses his fight at the judiciary on Tuesday night. 
Predicted Round 3 Cowboys team: Kalyn Ponga, Kyle Feldt, Justin O’Neill, Kane Linnett, Javid Bowen, Michael Morgan, Johnathan Thurston, John Asiata, Jack Granville, Scott Bolton, Gavin Cooper, Ethan Lowe, Jason Taumalolo (pending judiciary). Interchange: Ben Hampton, Coen Hess, Patrick Kaufusi, Sam Hoare. 18th and 19th man: Shaun Fensom, Corey Jensen 
Sea Eagles mail: No changes are expected. 
Predicted Round 3 Sea Eagles team: Tom Trbojevic, Jorge Taufua, Dylan Walker, Brian Kelly, Akuila Uate, Blake Green, Daly Cherry-Evans, Brenton Lawrence, Api Koroisau, Nate Myles, Frank Winterstein, Curtis Sironen, Jake Trbojevic. Interchange: Cameron Cullen, Lewis Brown, Jarrad Kennedy, Billy Bainbridge. 18th and 19th man: Matthew Wright, Jackson Hastings. 
RAIDERS v TIGERS 
4pm AEDT Sunday, March 19 at GIO Stadium Tongue leads Viking Clap 1:08 
Raiders mail: Captain Jarrod Croker will be named in the 21-man squad to return two weeks early from a dislocated knee suffered in the All Stars fixture. 
Croker has trained strongly over the past two weeks and came through contact work unscathed, with a call to be made on his availability for Sunday’s clash to come later in the week. 
Dave Taylor is also available having served an NRL suspension and could force his way onto the bench, though a return via NSW Cup is more likely. 
Joey Leilua has been cleared of a knee injury and will be named. Clay Priest returns from suspension. 
Predicted Round 3 Raiders team: Jack Wighton, Nick Cotric, Elliott Whitehead, Joseph Leilua, Jordan Rapana, Blake Austin, Aidan Sezer, Junior Paulo, Josh Hodgson, Shannon Boyd, Josh Papalii, Iosia Soliola, Luke Bateman. Interchange: Adam Clydsdale, Dunamis Lui, Jeff Lima, Clay Priest. 18th and 19th: Jarrod Croker, Dave Taylor. 
Tigers mail: Matt Ballin returned from a knee injury on the weekend and could force his way onto the bench. Kyle Lovett is cleared to return from his suspension but likely to appear in NSW Cup. Tim Grant will return after missing Sunday’s loss with the flu. 
Predicted Round 3 Tigers team: James Tedesco, David Nofoaluma, Kevin Naiqama, Michael Chee Kam, Moses Suli, Mitchell Moses, Luke Brooks, Aaron Woods, Matt McIlwrick, Ava Seumanufagai, Chris Lawrence, Sauaso Sue, Elijah Taylor. Interchange: Matt Ballin, Tim Grant, Josh Aloiai, Jamal Idris. 18th and 19th man: Joel Edwards. Jack Littlejohn 
SHARKS V DRAGONS 
6.30pm AEDT Sunday, March 19 at Southern Cross Group Stadium Cronulla Crush Canberra 1:47 
Sharks mail: Valentine Holmes finally looks set to come back from a hamstring injury. 
Predicted Round 3 Sharks team: Valentine Holmes, Sosaia Feki, Jack Bird, Ricky Leutele, Edrick Lee, James Maloney, Chad Townsend, Andrew Fifita, Jayden Brailey, Matt Prior, Luke Lewis, Wade Graham, Paul Gallen. Interchange: Jayson Bukuya, Chris Heighington, Sam Tagataese, Tony Williams. 18th and 19th man: Gerard Beale, Jeremy Latimore. 
Dragons mail: Jai Field is expected to return from a rib injury. Tyson Frizell failed to finish the match on Sunday due to concussion but will be right to play this weekend. 
Predicted Round 3 Dragons team: Josh Dugan, Nene Macdonald, Euan Aitken, Tim Lafai, Jason Nightingale, Gareth Widdop, Josh McCrone, Russell Packer, Cameron McInnes, Paul Vaughan, Tyson Frizell, Joel Thompson, Jack de Belin. Interchange: Tariq Sims, Leeson Ah Mau, Jacob Host, Jai Field. 18th and 19th man: Kurt Mann, Luciano Leilua
